question: Will Canada hold a federal election in 2021?
description: This is a market on whether Canada will hold a federal election during 2021. This market will resolve to “Yes” if a Canadian federal election begins after the market creation date, August 11, 2021, 12:00 PM ET, and before the expiration date, January 1, 2022, 12:01 AM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No.” The beginning of the election is defined as the time when the Governor in Council of Canada issues a proclamation for a general election. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved in good faith at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

question: How many new US residential sales will the U.S. Census Bureau report for July?
description:
This is a scalar market on the number of new residential sales that the U.S. Census Bureau and the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development will report for July 2021. The lower bound for this market is 600,000 and the upper bound is 800,000. This market will resolve on the Census’ count of "New Houses Sold", in their "Monthly New Residential Sales" Report for the month of July 2021, scheduled to be released at the webpage https://www.census.gov/construction/nrs/index.html (see "Current Press Release: Full Report [PDF]" in the "New Residential Sales" section), on August 24, 2021. The resolution source will be checked at 5:00 PM ET on August 24, 2021. If the source is unavailable at that time, or does not have the New Residential Sales data for July 2021, it will be checked the following day at 5:00 PM ET, and once daily at that time until the data is available. If at 5:00 PM ET on September 1, 2021 the data is still unavailable, this market will resolve to 700,000, which is between the upper and lower bounds of the market. 

You can use the calculator to the right (underneath the Buy modal) to calculate how each Long or Short Token price corresponds with residential sales. Long and Short shares will settle proportionally to the outcome value if the final value is between these bounds, but if the final value exceeds either the upper or lower bound, the price of each Outcome Token is capped at $1 and $0. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved in good faith at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

question: Will inflation be 0.4% or more from July to August?
description:
This is a market on whether month-to-month inflation, as measured by the Bureau of Labor Statistics (CPI-U) will be 0.4% or more from July to August, when the BLS releases month-to-month inflation information for the preceding month of August on September 14, 2021, 8:30 AM ET. This market will resolve to “Yes” if the Bureau of Labor Statistics reports that, on a seasonally adjusted basis, the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers (CPI-U) increased by exactly 0.4 percent (i.e. forty hundredths of 1%) or more from July 2021 to August 2021. This market will resolve to “No” if the Bureau of Labor Statistics reports that, on a seasonally adjusted basis, the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers (CPI-U) increased by less than 0.4 percent (i.e. forty hundredths of 1%) from July 2021 to August 2021. 

The resolution source for this market will be the BLS July 2021 Consumer Price Index report (https://www.bls.gov/bls/news-release/cpi.htm), currently scheduled for release on September 14, 2021, 8:30 AM ET. Resolution of this market will take place upon release of the aforementioned data. Note that the resolution source for this market will be the official monthly BLS CPI news release which reports seasonally-adjusted month-to-month inflation to only one decimal point (e.g. 0.6%, 0.5%, etc). Thus, this is the level of precision that will be used when resolving the market (e.g. if seasonally adjusted month-to-month CPI-U is 0.3%, the market will resolve to “No”, if it is 0.4%, this market will resolve to “Yes”). In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

question: Who will come in 2nd place in the 2021 California recall election?
description:
This is a market on who will come in 2nd place in the recall election for California governor, currently scheduled for September 14, 2021. For the purposes of this market, if Gavin Newsom is recalled (removed) as Governor as a result of this election, he will be considered to have finished in 2nd place. Otherwise, if Gavin Newsom is not recalled (removed) as governor as a result of this election, the 2nd place finisher will be the candidate who receives the most votes. The resolution source will be any official results of the recall election.

The brackets are [Gavin Newsom, Larry Elder, Other].  If Larry Elder and another candidate receive exactly the same number of votes, the "Larry Elder" and "Other" brackets will resolve to 50 cents each. If this election is canceled, all brackets will resolve to 33.33 cents. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

question: Will Vitalik Buterin have a CryptoPunk Twitter profile picture before September 1, 2021?
description: This market will resolve to “Yes” if Vitalik Buterin has a CryptoPunk as his Twitter profile picture at any point after the date of this market’s inception, August 11, 2021, 4:30 PM ET, and before September 1, 2021, 12:01 AM ET. This market will resolve to “No” otherwise. The resolution source will be the profile picture on Vitalik Buterin’s Twitter page, https://twitter.com/VitalikButerin/. The MIC will make the determination as to whether his profile picture is of a CryptoPunk. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

question: Will 205 million people have received a dose of an approved COVID-19 vaccine in the US by September 1?
description: This is a market on whether 205 million people in The United States of America will have initiated vaccination, according to the CDC COVID tracker, by the resolution date, September 1, 2021, 8:00 PM ET. This market will resolve to "Yes" if 205 million people or more are listed as having received their initial dose of vaccination by the resolution source. This only concerns the first dose of vaccination. For vaccines requiring two doses for inoculation, this market considers only the first dose as having initiated vaccination. This market will resolve to "No" if, for any reason, fewer than 205 million people have initiated vaccination by the resolution date. The resolution source for this market will be the official data published by the CDC available at https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#vaccinations, and will be checked at the resolution time/date. If the website is down, the most recently available data will be used to resolve the market. If the website is not down, this market will resolve according to the data as available immediately at the time of resolution, and resolution will not be delayed for the purpose of waiting for updated data from a specific date. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).
